cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida and 455 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf, then slowing and turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast with a probable strike in southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast early Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana–Mississippi border (Grand Isle LA to MS coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Grand Isle, Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Alabama/Florida border, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Lake Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama coasts from the Mississippi River Delta eastward
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) increasingly likely Monday night with a 59% chance of 34-kt winds and up to a 27% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if intensification occurs before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 6–9 ft mouth of Mississippi River and 2–4 ft in Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas which can back up into the lower Mississippi River reach serving the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated 18 inches possible, producing flash and river flooding along the Mississippi River corridor near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado threat in outer rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents which may hinder vessel movements and pilot transfers.
